meanings.definition: A knee-length skirt with pleats at the back, originating in the traditional dress of men and boys in the Scottish Highlands.
meanings.sent1: He wore a kilt to the Scottish festival.
meanings.sent2: The bagpiper played while wearing his kilt.
meanings.sent3: The kilt swirled as he danced a Highland jig.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like the bright colors of a kilt.
meanings.sent5: The kilt symbolized his Scottish heritage.

meanings.definition: To tuck up (a skirt) around one's body.
meanings.sent1: She had to kilt her dress to walk through the muddy field.
meanings.sent2: He quickly kilted up his robe to avoid tripping.
meanings.sent3: The wind unexpectedly kilted her skirt, revealing colorful socks.
meanings.sent4: The chef deftly kilted his apron before starting to cook.
meanings.sent5: The hiker kilted his pants to cross the stream.

meanings.definition: To pleat or tuck up (a skirt) around one's body.
meanings.sent1: She needed to kilt her skirt to climb the stairs.
meanings.sent2: The dancers kilted their costumes for the performance.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally kilted his shirt while trying to fix the hem.
meanings.sent4: The tailor skillfully kilted the fabric for the traditional outfit.
meanings.sent5: The children giggled as they kilted their school uniforms for fun.
